intro: Alocasia sarawakensis, commonly known as the Sarawak Alocasia, is a tropical plant native to Borneo. It belongs to the Araceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can reach up to 1 meter in diameter. The plant produces striking spathes that enclose its small, white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining, nutrient-rich soil. Alocasia sarawakensis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its dramatic foliage.
